paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Patients who underwent liver transplantation for hereditary ATTR amyloidosis.
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR) with various gastrointestinal symptoms.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The deceased patients had a significantly higher median age at onset (56.5 vs. 45.5 years, p < 0.01) and at LTx (58.7 vs. 49.1 years, p < 0.01) than those who had survived.
The deceased patients had a significantly higher median age at onset (56.5 vs. 45.5 years, p < 0.01) and at LTx (58.7 vs. 49.1 years, p < 0.01) than those who had survived.

functional_data.summary: The TTR mutations lead to decreased stability of the TTR tetramer, facilitating misfolding and amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR V30M mutation is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical observations.
variants.additional_notes: The study included patients with various TTR mutations, primarily V30M.
key_quotes: All patients but three carried the TTR V30M mutation, the other variants being the TTR L55Q, A97S and F33L mutations.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene variants.
